headline: Exclusive-Boeing close to funding agreement to help supplier Spirit Aero, source says
summary: Spirit AeroSystems and Boeing are close to reaching a funding agreement that would give a cash lifeline to the struggling Boeing supplier, an industry source familiar with the matter said.  Spirit Aero is juggling financial and production challenges, having issued a liquidity warning on Tuesday after four years of losses.  Boeing, which plans to buy its one-time subsidiary, is trying to revive its battered supply chain and jet production after a weeks-long strike halted most of its output.

Boeing, which plans to buy its one-time subsidiary, is trying to revive its battered supply chain and jet production after a weeks-long strike halted most of its output.

headline: Boeing CEO Takes Step to Heal Broken Culture
summary: One of new  Boeing  CEO Kelly Ortberg’s most important jobs is improving the plane maker’s employee relations and corporate culture.  Boeing announced Thursday that it would reimburse furloughed workers for pay lost during the contentious labor strike that began on Sept. 13 and lasted more than 50 days, according to the Seattle Times.  This is pay for workers not on strike, but those that Boeing asked to not come to work because of the strike.

headline: Retired General on How Ukraine Is ‘Bleeding Out’ Against Russia
summary: Ukraine faces an increasingly bleak road ahead after two-and-a-half years of war. Retired Brigadier Gen. Mark Kimmit breaks down recent battlefield challenges in the shifting front lines with Russia.

headline: Boeing to repay furloughed staff, proceed with job cuts
summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -Boeing CEO Kelly Ortberg said on Thursday that employees furloughed during a seven-week strike by factory workers would be repaid by the company for lost wages, but it would proceed with plans to cut about 10% of its global workforce.  Boeing furloughed thousands of salaried employees on a rolling basis after the strike by 33,000 union machinists began in September and halted production of its best-selling 737 MAX.  "Your sacrifice made a difference and helped the company bridge to this moment," Ortberg told staff in an email seen by Reuters.

Boeing furloughed thousands of salaried employees on a rolling basis after the strike by 33,000 union machinists began in September and halted production of its best-selling 737 MAX.  "Your sacrifice made a difference and helped the company bridge to this moment," Ortberg told staff in an email seen by Reuters.
